game

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class World
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that represents the world. Contains a 2d array of game objects, in which could represent keys, doors etc. This class populates the world and is responsible for redrawing it. This class is also responsible for the logic of the game. i.e. where players can or cannot move etc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setUpWorld

        public void setUpWorld()
        Sets up the World and all the components in it

      • setPlayerPositionFields

        public void setPlayerPositionFields()
        Sets the Fields needed for players position according to where the player is in the array

      • redraw

        public void redraw(java.awt.Graphics g,
          int width,
          int height)
        Redraw method - Draws the whole world, including the players, npc, enemies and the map. Draws the world so that it is relative to the player, player is always in the middle.
        Parameters:
        g - - Graphics canvas
        width - - width of screen
        height - - height of screen

      • nearFloor

        public boolean nearFloor(int x,
                int y)
        Checks if any of the adjacent tiles are of type floor
        Parameters:
        x - X position of Tile
        y - Y position of Tile
        Returns:
        True if adjacent to Floor Tile, false otherwise

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Player> getPlayers()
        Returns a Map of players bound by ID number keys
        Returns:
        Map of Players

        public void worldToImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
        Takes an image and displays the world on it
        Parameters:
        bi - Image to have world drawn on

      • getMap

        public Tile[][] getMap()
        Returns the map of tiles

      • move

        public void move(Player.Direction dir,
        int uid)
        Moves the player, according to what keys were pressed and checks if the move is valid or not. If the move is valid it moves the player, if not it doesn't
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction the player is being moved

      • checkDoor

        public boolean checkDoor(int uid,
                GameObject tile)
        Checks if a door is open or not. (unlocked or locked) Returns true if the door is open, returns false if not.
        Parameters:
        uid - - player number.
        tile - - Item that is contained within the tile you are checking.
        Returns:
        true if unlocked, false if locked.

      • checkTile

        public Tile checkTile(Player.Direction dir,
             int uid,
             int distance)
        Checks what the surrounding tile is given the direction, and returns it. Checks the tiles distance spaces away from the player. Returns null if there are no tiles in the specified direction
        Parameters:
        dir - - Direction that the player will move
        Returns:
        Tile that is next to the player, given the direction, returns null if there are no tiles in that direction

      • replaceTile

        public void replaceTile(Player.Direction dir,
               int uid,
               java.lang.String image,
               java.lang.String name,
               int distance)
        Replaces the tile in the map where the player will move to with a grass tile. (used for picking up items)
        Parameters:
        dir - - Direction that the player will move to
        uid - - player identification
        image - - string of image location
        name - - name of image.

      • registerPlayer

        public int registerPlayer(int uid)
        Adds a player to the game and the id assigned
        Returns:
        ID number

      • registerPlayer

        public int registerPlayer(int uid,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Adds a player to the world in the given position with the ID given, returning the ID on successful add
        Parameters:
        uid - ID of player
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        Returns:
        ID of player

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • replaceTile

        public void replaceTile(Player.Direction dir,
               int uid,
               Item item,
               int distance)
        Replaces the tile in the map where the player will move to with item from inventory (used for picking up items)
        Parameters:
        dir - - Direction that the player will move to
        uid - - player identification
        item - - Item to be replaced
        distance - distance from player of tile replacement
